title: Getting started as a DJ: Mixing, mashups and digital turntables - Cole Plante

options.label: B

options.text: To create a new song from scratch

options.label: B
options.text: To trigger samples, tracks, or clips and create a long journey

options.label: D

options.label: D

title: Caesium or Cesium - Periodic Table of Videos

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary use of caesium in science?

options.label: A
options.text: To measure temperature

options.label: B
options.text: To measure time

options.label: C
options.text: To measure pressure

options.label: D
options.text: To measure volume

multiple-choice.question: Why is caesium used to define the second in terms of microwaves?

options.label: A
options.text: Because it is a small atom

options.label: B
options.text: Because it is a big atom that can absorb microwaves with enormous precision

options.label: C
options.text: Because it is a dense material

options.label: D
options.text: Because it is a rare element

multiple-choice.question: What happens when caesium is dropped into water?

options.label: A
options.text: It dissolves slowly and releases a small amount of gas

options.label: B
options.text: It reacts violently and releases a large amount of hydrogen gas

options.label: C
options.text: It solidifies and sinks to the bottom

options.label: D
options.text: It melts and forms a layer on top of the water

multiple-choice.question: Why is the reaction between caesium and water so violent?

options.label: A
options.text: Because caesium is a very small atom

options.label: B
options.text: Because caesium is a very large atom and an electron can be removed very easily

options.label: C
options.text: Because caesium is a dense material

options.label: D
options.text: Because caesium is a rare element

multiple-choice.question: What is the result of the reaction between the electron released by caesium and water?

options.label: A
options.text: The formation of a caesium salt and oxygen gas

options.label: B
options.text: The formation of a caesium salt and hydrogen gas

options.label: C
options.text: The formation of a caesium salt and nitrogen gas

options.label: D
options.text: The formation of a caesium salt and carbon dioxide gas

options.label: C

options.label: A
options.text: A squirrel dying in your front yard may be more relevant to your interest right now than people dying in Africa.

options.label: B

options.label: A

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D
options.text: They are too expensive.

options.label: B
options.text: Algorithmic editing.

options.label: C
options.text: Personalized web.

options.label: D
options.text: Information junk food.

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: They should only show us what is relevant.

options.label: C
options.text: They should show us things that are uncomfortable or challenging or important.

options.label: D
options.text: They should be faster and more efficient.

title: Why do we cry? The three types of tears - Alex Gendler

multiple-choice.question: What is the main function of the basal tears that Iris constantly produces?

options.label: A
options.text: To wash away harmful substances or particles

options.label: B
options.text: To keep Iris hydrated and repel invasive bacteria

options.label: C
options.text: To signal Iris's emotional state to others

options.label: D
options.text: To stabilize Iris's mood

multiple-choice.question: What happens to the sulfoxides in Onion's jacket when it is removed?

options.label: A
options.text: They are converted into a harmless substance

options.label: B
options.text: They are released into the air as a fragrance

options.label: C
options.text: They are converted into sulfenic acid and then into syn-Propanethial S-oxide

options.label: D
options.text: They are absorbed into Onion's skin

multiple-choice.question: What is the main difference between reflex tears and basal tears?

options.label: A
options.text: Reflex tears are produced in smaller amounts than basal tears

options.label: B
options.text: Reflex tears are designed to wash away harmful substances or particles

options.label: C
options.text: Reflex tears are produced only when Iris is emotional

options.label: D
options.text: Reflex tears are produced only at night

multiple-choice.question: What is one possible function of emotional tears, according to scientists?

options.label: A
options.text: To elicit sympathy from others

options.label: B
options.text: To show submission to others

options.label: C
options.text: To stabilize the mood as quickly as possible

options.label: D
options.text: All of the above

multiple-choice.question: What do emotional tears contain higher levels of, according to some studies?

options.label: A
options.text: Antibodies to stop microorganisms

options.label: B
options.text: Stress hormones, such as ACTH and enkephalin

options.label: C
options.text: Lipids to keep the surface smooth

options.label: D
options.text: Mucus to fasten the tears to the eye
